name: PARA[Kill On]SITE
description:
You are a parasite, trapped in a facility, you must take over a host and butcher your way out! Careful not to stop rampaging too long you need to keep consuming on order to survive... also they have set the place to explode! Kill as many humans as you can and escape before time runs out! Also... watch out, if you stay in one host too long, you will die!

Para[Kill on]site was made for the createChester game jam run by the university of chester created by the team "Error 303: Team name not found" with the theme, benefit from death. We made this in 3 days as a team of 6 people!

Para[Kill on]site is a top down action game where you control a small parasite, that enters its enemies and uses them to fight. You can only stay in one host for a short amount of time before it dies and you with it, so you must constantly change bodies. There is also a timer for how long the game will last, you have to kill as many enemies as you can and escape before then!

Creatures: Brute creatures - whlie slower will break down doors, Fast creatures, and AoE creatures

Controls: 

W, A, S, D to move (or arrow keys)

E to change bodies with other creatures

Left Click (On Mouse) to attack

Requires: 

Windows PC

Team Members:

  • Jake Preece (Level 6) – 3D Art, 2D Art and Game/Level Design
  • Jordan Holman (Level 5) – Programming, 2D Art and Game Design
  • Joe Barlow (Level 5) – Programming
  • Ryan Eshraghi-Yazdi (Level 4) – Programming 2D Art and 3D Art
  • Edward Dawson (Level 4) – Programming, 2D Art and Game/Level Design
  • Brandon Healey (Level 4) – 3D Art and Game/Level Design

Contributions:

Jake Preece:

Jake undertook the task of creating, unwrapping and texturing the most advanced models of the game (the Monsters, Scientists and Guards) and created the 2D art for the intro to the game and its premise as well as the Game Icon. He also undertook the construction and final layout of the game’s map/level and applied textures to the map/environment models, as well as helped with the Itch.io page

Jordan Holman:

Jordan was the one behind the programming for the AI and their movement using Nav Mesh and Waypoints for them to pathfind throughout the map. He also programmed interactions of the AI once it saw the player.

Joe Barlow:

Joe programmed player movement and the player actions such as switching Host bodies upon death and attacking the AI.

Ryan Eshraghi-Yazdi:

Ryan coded the UI features such as the Timers and Kill counter, the menu buttons, the Pause Screen and the Main Menu making sure it all worked as intended. Afterwards towards the end of the process set up the Itch.io page for the game and filled out a lot of the info pertaining to the game and the gameplay.

Edward Dawson:

Edward created the script for the spawning of enemies including things such as a spawning limit and added the spawning points to the map. They also designed the UI buttons, Main Menu screen, Background art, and Title art for the game and designed a Cover Image for the Itch.io page.

Brandon Healey:

Brandon created and unwrapped all the Map/Building Models (such as the walls, floors, corridors, and doors) to be used in the creation of the level, designed the first drafts of the level layout, and provided added details to the Itch.io page.

Mentoring:

The Level 5 and 6 Students were very helpful and mindful of the experience of the Level 4 students. They took out plenty of time to help solve any problems, run through solutions and teach the Level 4 students how to use and/or navigate the software used in the process of creating the game. There was good communication between all members of the group; no one was left out of important discussions on the ideas for the game and mechanics within, and everyone was encouraged to bring ideas in no matter their level of experience. Everyone was ready and willing to help one another to help things to run as smoothly as they could go.
